comments:
gentoo distribution

From the newsgroup - Xavi wrote:

> Where did you obtain mozilla-1.6-r1 from? You need Mozilla 1.6 GTK2
such as the one 
> available from the Mozilla XFT website indicated in the SWT FAQ: 

I've installed several mozilla versions, emerging it or from Mozilla XFT
website. The version I've now installed is Mozilla 1.6 GTK2 downloaded
from http://www.scottbolander.com/mozilla-1.6-xft-gtk2-pc-linux.tar.bz2

This morning I've tried again to install from skratch so I've uninstall
the previous installation, I've uncompressed the file downloaded, I've
set up again the environment variables
MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME="/usr/lib/mozilla" and
LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/lib/mozilla"

Where /usr/lib/mozilla is mozilla installation directory. This is the
same I did the other times. But now I get a different error, here it is:

<error>
Exception in thread "main" org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles 
[Unknown mozilla path]

		 at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2717)
		 at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:128)
		 at ExtendedPlayer.<init>(ExtendedPlayer.java:20)
		 at ExtendedPlayer.main(ExtendedPlayer.java:31)


Exception in thread "main" 
</error>

[Unknown mozilla path] happens when the environment variable MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME 
is not set. The Browser retrieves the content of this environment variable and 
gets nothing.

Any chance this last error is due to a typo?

open a terminal and type in the following commands.
csh
setenv MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME /usr/lib/mozilla
eclipse

How far does this go?

Hi Chris,
maybe [Unknown mozilla path] was due to a type error. I've solved this, but now
I'm receiving again the error:

<error>
/opt/blackdown-jdk-1.4.2_rc1/bin/java: error while loading shared 
libraries: 
/usr/lib/eclipse-3/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk_3.0.0/os/linux/x86/libswt-mozilla-gtk-3062.so:

undefined symbol: NS_InitEmbedding
</error>

Weird. It is as if somehow it is not grabbing the Mozilla 1.6GTK2 but another 
one like a firefox build.

Just to be sure, I would try the following:
- create a new folder e.g. /usr/mozilla16gtk2
- install the build http://www.scottbolander.com/mozilla-1.6-xft-gtk2-pc-
linux.tar.bz2 into this folder.
- csh
- setenv MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME /usr/mozilla16gtk2
- setenv LD_LIBRARY_PATH ${MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME}
- eclipse

Still fail the same way?

Xavi - please reopen if this is still a problem for you. Note that next 
integration build Aug 31st is expected to work with Mozilla 1.7 (GTK2) as well.

Sorry for the lack of my response.

I've been testing what you say but I'm still getting the same error.

<error>
/opt/blackdown-jdk-1.4.2_rc1/bin/java: error while loading shared 
libraries: 
/usr/lib/eclipse-3/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk_3.0.0/os/linux/x86/libswt-
mozilla-gtk-3062.so:

undefined symbol: NS_InitEmbedding
</error>


Do you think this problem can be due to firefox? I'll try to uninstall it and 
see what happens.

Thanks :-)

Marking as INVALID on the assumption that the path currently grabs Firefox or 
any other unsupported version of Mozilla.
